TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit ModuleHandle extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Represents a runtime handle for a module.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ModuleHandle.ResolveFieldHandle%2A>, <xref:System.ModuleHandle.ResolveMethodHandle%2A>, and <xref:System.ModuleHandle.ResolveTypeHandle%2A> methods provide efficient resolution of metadata tokens to runtime handles for fields, methods, and types in the current module.

Docs.summary: Returns a <xref:System.Boolean> value indicating whether the specified structure is equal to the current .
Docs.returns: if is equal to the current structure; otherwise .
Docs.value: if is equal to the current structure; otherwise .

MemberSignature.Value: public int MDStreamVersion { get; }
.property instance int32 MDStreamVersion

Docs.value: A 32-bit integer representing the metadata stream version. The high-order two bytes represent the major version number, and the low-order two bytes represent the minor version number.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > For more information on the metadata header, see the Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics documentation. The documentation is available online; see [ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=99212) on MSDN and [Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65552) on the Ecma International Web site.

Docs.returns: A 32-bit integer representing the metadata stream version. The high-order two bytes represent the major version number, and the low-order two bytes represent the minor version number.

MemberSignature.Value: public RuntimeFieldHandle ResolveFieldHandle (int fieldToken);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.RuntimeFieldHandle ResolveFieldHandle(int32 fieldToken) cil managed

Docs.param: A metadata token that identifies a field in the module.
Docs.summary: Returns a runtime handle for the field identified by the specified metadata token.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.RuntimeFieldHandle> for the field identified by .

remarks.format:
## Remarks To resolve a metadata token that identifies a field whose parent `TypeSpec` has a signature containing element type `var` or `mvar`, use the [ResolveFieldHandle(Int32, RuntimeTypeHandle\[\], RuntimeTypeHandle\[\])](assetId:///M:System.ModuleHandle.ResolveFieldHandle(System.Int32,System.RuntimeTypeHandle[],System.RuntimeTypeHandle[])?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=False) method overload, which allows you to supply the necessary context.
> [!NOTE] > Information about metadata tokens can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics". The documentation is available online; see [ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=99212) on MSDN and [Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65552) on the Ecma International Web site.

Docs.exception:
is not a valid token in the scope of the current module.
-or-
is not a token for a field in the scope of the current module.
-or-
identifies a field whose parent has a signature containing element type or .
The method is called on an empty field handle.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.RuntimeFieldHandle> for the field identified by .

MemberSignature.Value: public RuntimeFieldHandle ResolveFieldHandle (int fieldToken, RuntimeTypeHandle[] typeInstantiationContext, RuntimeTypeHandle[] methodInstantiationContext);

.method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.RuntimeFieldHandle ResolveFieldHandle(int32 fieldToken, valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle[] typeInstantiationContext, valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle[] methodInstantiationContext) cil managed

Docs.param: A metadata token that identifies a field in the module.
An array of <xref:System.RuntimeTypeHandle> structures representing the generic type arguments of the type where the token is in scope, or if that type is not generic.
An array of <xref:System.RuntimeTypeHandle> structures representing the generic type arguments of the method where the token is in scope, or if that method is not generic.
Docs.summary: Returns a runtime field handle for the field identified by the specified metadata token, specifying the generic type arguments of the type and method where the token is in scope.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.RuntimeFieldHandle> for the field identified by .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > Information about metadata tokens can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics". The documentation is available online; see [ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=99212) on MSDN and [Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65552) on the Ecma International Web site.

Docs.exception:
is not a valid token in the scope of the current module.
-or-
is not a token for a field in the scope of the current module.
-or-
identifies a field whose parent has a signature containing element type or .
The method is called on an empty field handle.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.RuntimeFieldHandle> for the field identified by .

MemberSignature.Value: public RuntimeMethodHandle ResolveMethodHandle (int methodToken);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.RuntimeMethodHandle ResolveMethodHandle(int32 methodToken) cil managed

Docs.param: A metadata token that identifies a method or constructor in the module.
Docs.summary: Returns a runtime method handle for the method or constructor identified by the specified metadata token.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.RuntimeMethodHandle> for the method or constructor identified by .

remarks.format:
## Remarks To resolve a metadata token for a `MethodSpec` whose signature contains element type `var` or `mvar`, use the [ResolveMethodHandle(Int32, RuntimeTypeHandle\[\], RuntimeTypeHandle\[\])](assetId:///M:System.ModuleHandle.ResolveMethodHandle(System.Int32,System.RuntimeTypeHandle[],System.RuntimeTypeHandle[])?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=False) method overload, which allows you to supply the necessary context.
> [!NOTE] > Information about metadata tokens can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics". The documentation is available online; see [ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=99212) on MSDN and [Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65552) on the Ecma International Web site.

Docs.exception:
is not a valid metadata token for a method in the current module.
-or-
is not a token for a method or constructor in the scope of the current module.
-or-
is a whose signature contains element type or .
The method is called on an empty method handle.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.RuntimeMethodHandle> for the method or constructor identified by .

MemberSignature.Value: public RuntimeMethodHandle ResolveMethodHandle (int methodToken, RuntimeTypeHandle[] typeInstantiationContext, RuntimeTypeHandle[] methodInstantiationContext);

.method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.RuntimeMethodHandle ResolveMethodHandle(int32 methodToken, valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle[] typeInstantiationContext, valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle[] methodInstantiationContext) cil managed

Docs.param: A metadata token that identifies a method or constructor in the module.
An array of <xref:System.RuntimeTypeHandle> structures representing the generic type arguments of the type where the token is in scope, or if that type is not generic.
An array of <xref:System.RuntimeTypeHandle> structures representing the generic type arguments of the method where the token is in scope, or if that method is not generic.
Docs.summary: Returns a runtime method handle for the method or constructor identified by the specified metadata token, specifying the generic type arguments of the type and method where the token is in scope.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.RuntimeMethodHandle> for the method or constructor identified by .

remarks.format:

The method is called on an empty method handle.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To resolve a metadata token for a `TypeSpec` whose signature contains element type `var` or `mvar`, use the [ResolveTypeHandle(Int32, RuntimeTypeHandle\[\], RuntimeTypeHandle\[\])](assetId:///M:System.ModuleHandle.ResolveTypeHandle(System.Int32,System.RuntimeTypeHandle[],System.RuntimeTypeHandle[])?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=False) method overload, which allows you to supply the necessary context.
> [!NOTE] > Information about metadata tokens can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics". The documentation is available online; see [ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=99212) on MSDN and [Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65552) on the Ecma International Web site.

Docs.exception:
is not a valid metadata token for a type in the current module.
-or-
is not a token for a type in the scope of the current module.
-or-
is a whose signature contains element type or .
The method is called on an empty type handle.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.RuntimeTypeHandle> for the type identified by .

MemberSignature.Value: public RuntimeTypeHandle ResolveTypeHandle (int typeToken, RuntimeTypeHandle[] typeInstantiationContext, RuntimeTypeHandle[] methodInstantiationContext);

.method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle ResolveTypeHandle(int32 typeToken, valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle[] typeInstantiationContext, valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle[] methodInstantiationContext) cil managed

Docs.param: A metadata token that identifies a type in the module.
An array of <xref:System.RuntimeTypeHandle> structures representing the generic type arguments of the type where the token is in scope, or if that type is not generic.
An array of <xref:System.RuntimeTypeHandle> structures objects representing the generic type arguments of the method where the token is in scope, or if that method is not generic.
Docs.summary: Returns a runtime type handle for the type identified by the specified metadata token, specifying the generic type arguments of the type and method where the token is in scope.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.RuntimeTypeHandle> for the type identified by .

remarks.format:
